intro: Ditaxis serrata var. californica, commonly known as the California ditaxis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have serrated edges, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is valued in gardens for its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
